item.title: Cut back over growth needs removing, 29th December
item.description:
Friends of Priory Gardens have found this over grown area by the pond is used as a public toilet/drug use anti social behaviour and litter den. We have started to cut back the dead willow and brambles to clear the land so that people can't hind in this area. Creating a more healthy safe place. The thicker branches could do with a power tool to cut them back more so people don't walk into the branches sticking out. We will be cutting back this bed further to open up the grass as it was before it became over grown like this. Many thanks

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Court Road, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Extremely noisy loose manhole cover, 29th December
item.description:
Two weeks ago the council closed the previous report for this particular problem, and marked it as "fixed". The problem is not fixed and still persists. It is extremely noisy and disruptive, as per attached video. Please just get on with it? Copy-paste of previous report below: The manhole cover on Norman road( in front of BPTW architecture company,SE10 9JE) is loosed (sic) and very noisy in the night( when cars passed it). Please fix it ASAP

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Norman Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Flytipped mattress between allotment and outbuilding, 29th December
item.description:
There is a flytipped mattress and other rubbish in the space between the allotment fence and a small building. It is near 29 Borland Road, directly to the right of the allotment gate, by the tree. There is a similar resolved report on this location, but the mattress is still there. It has been there for a few months. Please remove it asap. Thank you!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Borland Road, Nunhead, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Safety fence cut and collapsed on green at Okemore Gardens, 29th December
item.description:
A section of the wooden safety fence on the green at Okemore Gardens has been deliberately cut and is now broken and lying on the ground. Multiple fence rails and supports are detached, leaving the area completely unfenced. This is immediately next to a pedestrian path and close to the road, presenting an urgent safety risk, particularly for children, pedestrians and pets who could easily access the road. The damage has been present for several days and requires prompt repair to prevent injury or further incidents

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crockenhill Road, St Mary Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
